topics.body:
!https://40.media.tumblr.com/7c4d662d7a7dc96682354269e9bbc823/tumblr_nklpreRis71rhavdko1_500.png!
"The “Star Wars” series has been an immense career boost for most of its stars, however, for Jake Lloyd, who played Anakin Skywalker in “Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace,” it’s been nothing but a nightmare. So much so, in fact, that he left acting forever.

"My entire school life was really a living hell, and I had to do up to 60 interviews a day," says Lloyd in an interview with the U.K. tabloid The Sun. “Other children were really mean to me…They would make the sound of the lightsaber every time they saw me. It was totally mad.”"


You know as shitty an actor he was, he was still a kid

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f4d7386368721592920200#post_54f4d7386368721592920200
Touhou's popularity is starting to wane in Japan, but that's one of the reasons why I'm excited for it to finally come to the west to give it a third wind.  I think Zun realizes that it needs to come to the west as well.

In the Urban Legend in Limbo trial there is parts that are already in English; rumor mill, but that insinuates that it will either at launch or at a later date have a English version.

Zun is looking at releases Touhou on Steam, but that might or might not happen cause he no longer has the original source files for the first few games.
